locale.name: en_US
locale.message: Click here to go to step one of the five-step submission process.
Step 2. Entering the Main Proposal's Metadata
Step 3. Uploading the Main Proposal File
You can complete this submission at a later date by selecting Active Proposals from the Investigator home page.
This site is not accepting proposals at this time.
Please consider waiving the Article Submission Fee for this article
Please use the comments box below to indicate why fees should be waived.
If you are applying for a waiver, you must enter a reason in the space provided.
Are you sure you want to delete this draft?
Are you sure you want to withdraw your submission? You cannot undo this action.
Are you sure you want to send this proposal to the Archive section?

If the proposal is submitted by a student enrolled in UHS or affiliated with UHS or if the research is conducted by UHS staff, please select the Ethics Committee of the University of Health Sciences, but if the research is conducted with an external partner (not in collaboration with UHS) or ministry of health staff including NIOPH staff, please select National Ethics Committee for Health Research.
This site accepts proposals in several languages. Choose the primary language of the submission from the pulldown below.
Indicate that this proposal is ready to be considered by the Committee by checking off the following (comments to the Secretary can be added at Step 5).
You must make sure all items in the submission checklist are satisfied before continuing.

The principal investigators agree to the terms of this Copyright Notice, which will apply to this submission if and when it is published by this site (comments to the Committee Secretariat can be added below).
You must agree to the terms of the Copyright Notice before continuing.
Please select an appropriate Ethics Committee for your proposal.
Please select a type of research.
Please select if the research involves others country.
Please select at least one research field
Reorder principal investigators to appear in the order they will be listed on site.
Provide terms for indexing the submission; separate terms with a semi-colon (term1; term2; term3).
Identify agencies that provided funding or support for the work presented in this submission.
Refers to geo-spatial location, chronological or historical coverage, and/or characteristics of research sample.
Use the hyperlinked classification system to select classification terms and, if appropriate, numbers.
At least one investigator is required.
The first name, last name, affiliation, phone number, and email address of each investigator is required.
Please enter the scientific title of your research proposal.
Please enter the public title of your research proposal.
Please select Yes or No (Student Initiated Research).
Please specify the institution of the student.
Please specify the academic degree of the student.
Please enter the abstract of your research proposal.
Please enter the background of your research proposal. Background: Key issues under investigation, importance, what is known already, and why this study.
Please enter the objectives of your research proposal. Objectives: Key research questions, hypothesis, objectives in bullet points if feasible.

Please enter the study methods of your research proposal. Study Methods: Relevant features of study design (qualitative/quantitative, cross-sectional survey/case-control...), estimated sample size, manner of data collection, etc. [e.g. study involves key informant interviews with policy-makers in Philippines, involving 6-8 people at national or provincial level...]

Please enter the expected outcomes and use of results of your research proposal. Expected outcomes and use of results: Potential outcomes of study such as measurement of prevalence, other indicators being measured, how the results will be used to inform particular policy or program...
Please enter keywords for your research proposal.
Please enter the start date of your research proposal.
Please enter the end date of your research proposal.
Please enter the funds required for your research.
Please select at least one region for this proposal.
Please indicate if the research involves human subjects.
Please enter the research proposal type.
Please specify the other proposal type.
Please select Yes or No (Submitting as Primary Investigator?).
Please select Yes or No (Reviewed By Other Committee?).
Please select Yes or No (Industry Grant?).
Please select Yes or No (Agency Grant?).
Please select Yes or No (Ministry of Health Grant?).
Please select Yes or No (Governmant Grant?).
Please select Yes or No (University Grant?).
Please select Yes or No (Self Funding?).
Please select Yes or No (Other Grant?).
Please verify that the risk assessment section is complete
Please indicate if the identity of the research subject(s) may be revealed during the research process.
Please indicate if the research subject(s) are (or may be) unable to consent.
Please indicate if the research subject(s) are (or may be) under 18 years old.
Please indicate if the research subject(s) are (or may be) in a dependent relationship with any of the research team members.
Please indicate if the research subject(s) are (or may be) from an ethnic minority group.
Please indicate if the research subject(s) are (or may be) with intellectual or mental impairment.
Please indicate if the research subject(s) are (or may be) pregnant.
Please indicate if the research includes new treatment(s), medical procedure(s) or test(s).
Please indicate if the research includes collection(s) of biological sample(s) including tissue extraction.
Please indicate if the research includes the use of ionizing radiation.
Please indicate if the research includes pain or psychological distress.
Please indicate if the research includes inducements.
Please indicate if the research includes collection of sensitive informations.
Please indicate if the research includes deception.
Please indicate if the research includes assisted reproductive technology.
Please indicate if the research includes human genetic or genomic studies.
Please indicate if the research includes stem cell.
Please indicate if the research includes biosafety issue(s).
Please indicate the level of risk of the research.
Please indicate how are the risks minimized/managed.
Please indicate if the research involves multiple institutions.
Please specify if a set of circumstances that creates a risk that professional judgment or actions regarding this research will be unduly influenced by a secondary interest.
You have exceeded the maximum word limit for abstracts.
RTO seeking an extension of time for their research must submit a request letter via this option.
Journal publications, news, items or any others publications related to research.
The final data set use for final analysis (Excel, SAS, SPSS or Stata).
No file uploaded. You need to upload your main proposal for going to step 4
Are you sure you wish to continue without uploading a file?

This optional step allows Supplementary Files to be added to a submission. The files, which can be in any format, might include (a) research instruments, (b) data sets, which comply with the terms of the study's research ethics review, (c) sources that otherwise would be unavailable to reviewers, (d) figures and tables that cannot be integrated into the text itself, or other materials that add to the contribution of the work.
Are you sure you wish to continue without uploading the supplementary file you have chosen?
No supplementary files have been added to this submission.
Are you sure you want to delete this supplementary file?
To index this supplementary material, provide the following metadata for the uploaded supplementary file.

Select file type(s)
(Hold down the CTRL [or CMD on mac] button to select multiple options.)
Present file to reviewers (without metadata), as it will not compromise blind review.
Use only with formally published materials.
Date when data was collected or instrument created.
Name of study or other point of origin.
Please enter the title of this supplementary file.
Public supplemental file identification already exists.

To submit your proposal to {$journalTitle} click Finish Submission. The investigator will receive an acknowledgement by email and will be able to view the submission's progress through the review process by logging into this web site.
No files have been attached to this submission.
Submission complete. Thank you for submitting your proposal.

If this submission is in a format that is ready to be published without further review, editing, or layout work, it can be placed directly in the last stage of the Editing queue by Clicking here. (Note: Only journal editors have this option for their proposals.)

A user account is required to submit to the Committee. This allows our Secretariat to track your proposals and contact you when the status of your submission changes, or if additional information is required from you.
